No. Not really.
It started because my contracts were mostly tied to remaining in the EU. Well, sort of. It was not so much EU work, but these British companies no longer wished to invest in their UK operations to the plummeting value of the pound. Within 2 days of the EU vote going through, six companies bought themselves out of their contract. This is because they felt they would be better poised to start marketing themselves elsewhere in the EU.
But, you will be pleased to know that I had to put 5 people into unemployment in the UK.
Cap this off with the fact that some of my staff are paid in SEK, which was abysmal when the exchange rates changed so rapidly, and it was a disaster.
So, don't tell me how it is due to me not managing my cash flow. It was due to the shoddy decision to leave the EU and the impact in my industry is going to be felt for years to come.
I am just a small company. I dread to think what larger companies are going through. They may be able to cope now, but when we leave the EU good and proper, companies *will* crumble.
Why are you pleased to leave the EU? What are your benefits?
And Labour have just lost my vote.

This meant I lost the 'new' place. - I live in Sweden, not necessarily a bad thing, but I can't really rely on my parents to help as they are in a different country. - My dog then died - My card stopped working at cash machines so I can't withdraw any money until I get to my bank which is an hour away. - I pissed off all my friends - The cat then died - Clients are threatening me. - 100% sure I am coping with depression
It is overwhelming every single day.
